medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe intrauterine growth restriction (IUGR) detected at 21 weeks of pregnancy with associated fetal abnormalities.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was assessed at week 21 of pregnancy after a morphological ultrasound revealed biometry not in accordance with gestational age, indicating an early diagnosis of severe IUGR. Fetal abnormalities were identified following the ultrasound, and the patient was informed about the findings and prognosis.
medical_history.family_history: Both parents are healthy, without apparent consanguinity between them.
